 1.2 - TIME-BASED MEDIA
AUDIO-ONLY (LIVE)(LEVEL AAA)
On accessible websites...

An alternative for time-based media that presents equivalent information for
live audio-only content is provided. 

These websites...

Provide alternatives for time-based media.

WHAT'S AN EXAMPLE?
A live radio play of a fringe theatre group is being broadcast to the Web. As
the actors stick largely to a set script, and the budget for the program is
small, the producers provide a link (with the playwright's permission) to the
script of the play. Iâ€™d like to know a little more
[https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG22/Understanding/audio-only-live.html#examples]

Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.2, W3C World Wide Web Consortium
Recommendation 21 May 2021 (https://www.w3.org/TR/2021/WD-WCAG22-20210521/,
Latest version at https://www.w3.org/TR/WCAG22/)
